results.title: The Best life
results.creator_credit: Keifer Yu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Keifer Yu takes us beyond the tourist attractions of Broome, Western Australia, to the cultures therein. Yu focuses on the Indigenous and Chinese cultures of which he is a part. He considers how the differing cultures have enriched his life and how they blend in together in this unique community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keifer Yu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Bird who is a clown
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the island Daphne Major of the Galapagos Islands which is a small island and nesting ground for hundrreds of Blue-footed Booby birds. Emphasises the mating and upbringing of the young in order to illustrate the development of the Booby and to reveal its behaviour patterns. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Introduces the island Daphne Major of the Galapagos Islands which is a small island and nesting ground for hundrreds of Blue-footed Booby birds. Emphasises the mating and upbringing of the young in order to illustrate the development of the Booby and to reveal its behaviour patterns. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Story to inspire
results.creator_credit: Tanika Deemal-Parker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Tanika Deemal-Parker has been singing all her life. She has been encouraged by her mum to take her singing further and, when doubts set in, it was her mum that helped her through with some words of wisdom.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Sam Kluk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sam Kluk loved his beautiful town of Kuranda in Northern Queensland. Unfortunately, there was another side to the quiet town and Kluk was determined to take every opportunity to escape it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Kluk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Biosphere
results.creator_credit: William Pettigrew, Colin Low, Peter Katadotis, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The McKenzie and Amazon Valleys are 10,000 kilometres distant from one another and are certainly distinct ecologically. Yet in a subtle sense they are collaborating elements within the biosphere - the Earth’s thin layer of living matter. This film examines two of the myriad river ecosystems and shows how they are linked within the biosphere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Pettigrew, Colin Low, Peter Katadotis, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Life in the Kimberleys
results.creator_credit: Rhys Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rhys Bedford has a lot of doors open to him, now that he is the recipient of a scholarship at Hale College in Western Australia. But it is when he returns to his family in Kununurra that Bedford gets to explore and reconnect with his country and heritage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rhys Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Big snit
results.creator_credit: Richard Condie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This wonderfully wacky animated film looks at two simultaneous conflicts, the macrocosm of global nuclear war and the microcosm of a domestic quarrel, and how each conflict is resolved. Presented with warmth and unexpectedly off-the-wall humour, the film is open to a multitude of interpretations. (Awards: Montreal, Toronto, Chicago, San Francisco, Annecy, Hiroshima, Cracow, Zagreb, Tampere)

results.brief_description: Seven digital stories from young Indigenous people about their upbringing, lives, family, friends, their hopes for the future and what it is like to grow up as an Indigenous Australian.

results.title: Young and proud
results.creator_credit: Leah Latham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A young, successful and proud Yamatji woman, Leah Latham attributes the person she is today to growing up with different cultures. She acknowledges it can be hard being a mix of English and Indigenous cultures, but believes it has also made her the person she is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leah Latham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: A young, successful and proud Yamatji woman, Leah Latham attributes the person she is today to growing up with different cultures. She acknowledges it can be hard being a mix of English and Indigenous cultures, but believes it has also made her the person she is today.

results.title: The Big picture: conservation treatment of a large painting
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, Department of Home Affairs and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: Conservators, Allan Byrne and Tom Dixon, discuss the restoration of the huge oil paint by Tom Roberts entitled “The Opening of the First Parliament of the Australian Commonwealth by His Majesty King George V (when Duke of York). 9th May 1901”. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels and tertiary/teacher level.
